intro: Ptychomeria tenella, commonly known as the narrow-leaf daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its small, daisy-like flowers with yellow centers and white petals. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and sandy soils, thriving in well-drained conditions. Ptychomeria tenella has narrow, linear leaves and is often used in ornamental gardening due to its delicate appearance. It is also valued for its ecological role in supporting local pollinators.
